title: Electron + React + TypeScript scaffold
description: Initialize the app using a modern toolchain (electron-vite with React + TypeScript). Include scripts: dev, build, lint, format. Ensure secure defaults: contextIsolation=true, sandbox where applicable, separate main, preload, and renderer packages. Acceptance: `pnpm/npm run dev` runs the app with React UI placeholder; `... build` yields a runnable app in dist; TypeScript config present; eslint/prettier configured.

features.title: Initialize Project with electron-vite
features.description: Use the `pnpm create electron-vite` command to scaffold a new project. Select the `react-ts` template. This will generate the initial project structure, including separate directories for main, preload, and renderer code, along with default TypeScript and ESLint configurations.
features.plan:
1. Run the scaffolding command `pnpm create electron-vite` in the root directory.
2. When prompted for the project name, enter `electron-react-ts-app`.
3. When prompted to select a framework, choose `react`.
4. When prompted to select a variant, choose `react-ts`.
5. Change the current directory to the newly created `electron-react-ts-app`.
6. Run `pnpm install` to install all the necessary dependencies.
7. List the files in the directory to confirm successful scaffolding.
acceptance: A `package.json` file is created in the root directory.
The project directory structure contains `src/main`, `src/preload`, and `src/renderer` subdirectories.
Configuration files for the toolchain, such as `electron.vite.config.ts`, `.eslintrc.cjs`, and `tsconfig.json`, are present.

features.title: Configure Linting and Formatting
features.description: Install project dependencies using `pnpm install`. Add Prettier for code formatting by installing `prettier` and `eslint-config-prettier`. Create a `.prettierrc` file with sensible defaults. Update the `.eslintrc.cjs` configuration to integrate with Prettier. Finally, add `lint` and `format` scripts to `package.json`.
features.plan:
Plan: Configure Linting and Formatting (Feature 1.2)

1) Create one-shot setup script
- Create a new directory scripts/ at the repo root.
- Add a Node ESM script scripts/setup-lint-format.mjs that performs all steps below idempotently (safe to re-run):
  a. Ensure dependencies are installed:
     - Execute: pnpm install
  b. Add development dependencies:
     - Execute: pnpm add -D prettier eslint-config-prettier
  c. Create or update .prettierrc at repo root with the following JSON (merge or overwrite if needed):
     {
       "semi": false,
       "singleQuote": true,
       "trailingComma": "all",
       "printWidth": 100
     }
  d. Create .prettierignore (if missing) with common ignores:
     node_modules
     dist
     build
     coverage
     out
     release
     .next
     .turbo
  e. Ensure .eslintignore (if missing) includes:
     node_modules
     dist
     build
     coverage
  f. Integrate Prettier into ESLint config:
     - If .eslintrc.cjs exists:
       • Read file as text and update the extends array to include 'prettier' as the last item if not already present.
       • Example extends: ['eslint:recommended', 'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended', 'prettier']
     - If .eslintrc.cjs does not exist, create a minimal one:
       module.exports = {
         root: true,
         parser: '@typescript-eslint/parser',
         plugins: ['@typescript-eslint'],
         extends: ['eslint:recommended', 'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended', 'prettier'],
       }
  g. Update package.json to add scripts (merge without overwriting existing unrelated scripts):
     - "lint": "eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx,.js,.jsx --report-unused-disable-directives --max-warnings 0"
     - "format": "prettier --write ."
     Notes:
       • If a lint script exists, ensure it runs eslint against ts/tsx at minimum; otherwise, replace with the above.
       • If a format script exists, ensure it invokes prettier --write .; otherwise, replace with the above.
  h. Print a summary of actions taken.

Implementation Notes for scripts/setup-lint-format.mjs:
- Use Node's child_process (exec or spawn) to run pnpm commands.
- Use fs/promises to read/write files.
- Handle JSON reading/writing for package.json and .prettierrc robustly with try/catch.
- For .eslintrc.cjs string updates, do minimal parsing: detect extends array with regex and append 'prettier' if missing; fall back to creating a new file if parsing fails.

2) Run the setup script
- Execute: node scripts/setup-lint-format.mjs
- Re-run if necessary; it should be idempotent.

3) Verify locally
- Run: pnpm run lint (should pass or report actual code issues).
- Run: pnpm run format (should format files without error).

4) Documentation
- Create docs/tasks/1/CONFIGURE_LINTING_FORMATTING.md detailing:
  - Purpose of Prettier + ESLint integration.
  - One-shot script usage (node scripts/setup-lint-format.mjs).
  - What was installed/created (.prettierrc, .prettierignore, .eslintignore, ESLint integration, package.json scripts).
  - How to run linting/formatting in daily workflow.
- Update docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md to include the scripts/ directory under Top-Level Directory Layout and reference the new docs file under docs/tasks/1/.

5) Tests (deterministic)
- Add tasks/1/tests/test_1_2.py to validate:
  - .prettierrc exists and contains keys: semi=false, singleQuote=true, trailingComma=all, printWidth=100.
  - package.json scripts include:
    • lint with eslint invocation (includes .ts,.tsx extensions).
    • format with 'prettier --write .'.
  - .eslintrc.cjs exists and its extends includes 'prettier'.
  - devDependencies include 'prettier' and 'eslint-config-prettier'.

6) Commit changes
- Commit new/modified files: scripts/setup-lint-format.mjs, .prettierrc, .prettierignore, .eslintignore (if created), .eslintrc.cjs (if created/updated), package.json, docs/tasks/1/CONFIGURE_LINTING_FORMATTING.md, docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md, tasks/1/tests/test_1_2.py.

7) Hand-off/CI
- If CI exists, ensure it calls pnpm install before running tests. No CI changes are strictly required for this feature.

features.title: Harden Security and Verify Build
features.description: Review the main process code in `electron/main/index.ts`. Ensure the `BrowserWindow` is created with `contextIsolation: true` and `sandbox: true` in its `webPreferences`. Run `pnpm run dev` to confirm the application starts correctly with the default React placeholder. Run `pnpm run build` and verify that it generates a runnable application in the `dist` directory.
